leeway noun [U]
(PERIOD OF TIME)
UK an amount or period of time that has been lost or wasted: There is a lot of leeway to make up after the holiday period.

freedom to act within certain limits: [ + to infinitive ] The law gives companies more leeway to decide whether to accept or reject an offer.
Leeway is also additional time or money: Homeowners need some leeway to buy a new house after they sell the old one.
